dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model
Class RCtxt

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.DCtxt
      dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model.RCtxt
All Implemented Interfaces:
IModelConstants
public class RCtxt
extends DCtxt

An RCtxt represents a DataModel that has a persistent storage location further called resource DataModel.

The resource DataModel represented by a RCtxt can be loaded from a persistent media (most likely a file) or stored to a persistent media.

A new RCtxt is created with create(Location): 

 RCtxt rctxt = RCtxt.create( new Location( new File( "c:\\TEMP\\my.xdm" ), "xdm" );

The storage location of the model is defined by an instance of Location that can reference one or multiple files or resources in a filesystem or at an other location. A location is described by an URI (Universal Resource Identifier) to allow loading of models from content of jar files for example. The Location also encodes the content format of the persistent model (e.g. XDM, Autosar ECU Config, DBC...) with a content type of the form: 

 type [ ":" version ]

For a list of available format please refer to the EB tresos Studio user's guide and search for 'File content types'.

A RCtxt allows to load and save models with the methods

  • load(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus)
  • save(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus)

To import/merge the loaded resource DataModel to the model of a project use the method DCtxt.merge(List, Map, APIOperationStatus) or DCtxt.merge(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus) of the project DataModel: 

 APIOperationStatus status = APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus();
 RCtxt rctxt = RCtxt.create( new Location( new File( "c:\\TEMP\\my.xdm" ), "xdm" );
 rctxt.load( projectDCtxt, null, status );
 projectDCtxt.merge( rctxt, null, status );

To export the content of a project DataModel into a file use the method DCtxt.merge(List, Map, APIOperationStatus) or DCtxt.merge(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus): 

 APIOperationStatus status = APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus();
 RCtxt rctxt = RCtxt.create( new Location( new File( "c:\\TEMP\\my.xdm" ), "xdm" );
 rctxt.merge( projectDCtxt, null, status );
 rctxt.save( projectDCtxt, null, status );

With the method setLocation(Location) the location or format of an RCtxt can be changed.

This functionality can be used for example to convert a file from one format to another: 

 APIOperationStatus status = APIOperationStatus.getOkStatus();
 RCtxt rctxt = RCtxt.create( new Location( new File( "c:\\TEMP\\my.xdm" ), "xdm" );
 rctxt.load( projectDCtxt, null, status );
 rctxt.setLocation( new Location( new File( "c:\\TEMP\\my.arxml", "asc:3.1" ); 
 rctxt.save( projectDCtxt, null, status );

Import options for load(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus) and save(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus) can be found in class dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.model.importer.ImporterConstants.

Method Detail

create

public static RCtxt create(Location location)
Creates a new empty resource DataModel that can be loaded and save to disk.

A resource DataModel can be loaded from a persistent storage media with load(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus) or saved with save(DCtxt, Map, APIOperationStatus).

The node tree of a non resource DataModel like one created with DCtxt.create() or a node tree from a DCtxt that points to a DataModel of a project can be transferred into a resource DataModel with DCtxt.merge(List, Map, APIOperationStatus).

The created RCtxt is created with options {Opt.OPT_NO_SCHEMA|Opt.OPT_ONLY_EXISTING| Opt.OPT_MARK_CALCULATED.

Since 12.0 the option Opt.OPT_USE_NODE_OPERATION is no longer set by default of the RCtxt.

Returns:
RCtxt pointing to the root node of the resource model.
Since:
11

load

public void load(DCtxt schemaModel,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> loadOptions,
                 APIOperationStatus status)
          throws CtxtException
Loads the content of a resource DataModel from a persistent media.

The data is loaded from the location in the format provided by the 'location' parameter of the create() method.

Parameters:
schemaModel - Some input formats like an ECU Configuration in AUTOSAR format require a schema (or parameter definition) that describes the structure of the data. This schema is provided with the schemaModel parameter
loadOptions - The parser that loads the data can or must be further customized by parser specific options given with this parameter. Use null for no loadOptions. See dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.model.importer.ImporterConstants for possible options
status - if errors or warnings occur during the import they are added to this APIOperationStatus object as sub states
Throws:
CtxtException - in case schemaModel is null
Since:
11

save

public void save(DCtxt schemaModel,
                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> saveOptions,
                 APIOperationStatus status)
          throws CtxtException
Saves the branch of the model to which this RCtxt points.

The model data is stored to the location and in the format provided with the parameter 'location' to the DCtxt.create() method.

Parameters:
schemaModel - Some output formats like an ECU Configuration in Autosar format require a schema (or parameter definition) the describes the structure of the data. This schema is provided with the schemaModel parameter
saveOptions - The parser that writes the data can or must be further customized by parser specific options given with this parameter. Use null for no saveOptions. See class dreisoft.tresos.autosar2.api.model.importer.ImporterConstants for possible options
status - if errors or warning occur during the writing they are added to this APIOperationStatus object as sub states
Throws:
CtxtException - in case schemaModel is null
Since:
11

Parameters:

CtxtException - in case location is null

the Location at which this model is stored
